page.title: 04INDUSTRY IN COOKLEY
page.content: The main source of industry is the steel works. This is situated by the canal. Originally it received its raw materials , and removed the finished product by this means of transport. However, the waterway has long since been superceeded by the road system. Unfortunately the narrow road through the village, connecting with the main{Wolverhampton}road is not really suitable for articulated vehicles carrying heavy iron products. The original iron works, which process 'raw' iron, moved to the Stourbridge area and the Steel Stampings factory now only produces cold stampings,mainly tractor wheels.
